Perhaps you heard him call it “probably my favorite knife that I own.” Perhaps you’ve even read a little story about this “one weird knife” in New York mag? Perhaps you’ve even attempted to find this elusive tool, which, up until now, has been challenging, to say the least. Well, here’s a very small piece of good news: Brad Leone’s cleaver/slicer of choice has officially been brought back into production by Lamson Products, a Massachusetts company since 1837. It’s now stocked in our shop, along with a whole slew of It’s Alive–themed merch.The man and his knife.
Photo by Laura MurrayWhat, you ask, is so special about this knife? Let’s ask the man himself: “I love the knife so much because of its lightweight and thin, large blade,” says Brad. “It’s a bench scraper and a knife.” The folks at Lamson added a few details: The full-tang blade (meaning, it runs the full length of the handle), in a Santoku shape, is made from tempered American high-carbon stainless steel that is flat-ground for precision and then hand-sharpened and finished for a razor-sharp edge. The ergonomically designed, contoured handle is made from durable walnut. The knife can be purchased as a set with a custom-made leather sheath, made from Wickett & Craig English bridle leather with double hand stitching, extra-strong brass rivets, and a brass snap that keeps the sheath firmly in place for storage. Whew! Lot of information. Shop for it here.Three more new items made for It’s Alive fans and pretty much no one elseThe Black Garlic Fan ShirtLoud. Distorted. Vigorous. Fermented. Inky. Sticky. Intense.
